fields.description:
It would be nice to have a report on files in a given branch or directory to display:
- the current version of the file
- the last reviewed version and
- the status of the last review
- possibly more relevant data
fields.summary: Crucible report to show review status for every file in branch/directory

fields.description:
We just recently upgraded to Crucible 3.1.4 from a 3.0.x version if I recall correctly, however we found out Crucible/Fisheye no longer works inside a HTML frameset.

We have an in-house built tool we use for our code review workflow, and display Crucible inside a HTML frame with our tool at the top of the screen in an 80px high frame.

After upgrading, commits no longer finish rendering, the page is all there and the left pane file listing shows everything but the middle just shows a spinning circle image and the page height hasn't resized to the browser window size, it stays much longer. Clicking files in the left pane doesn't do anything, the spinning circle just stays there. Also clicking the "Create Review" button inside the frame for the commit also produces a review dialog that doesn't properly work. The Firefox Web Developer tools doesn't report any JavaScript errors.

I've attached crucible_frame.html which is the HTML driving our frameset.

I've been working around the problem using the handy "This Frame > Open Frame in New Tab" feature of Firefox, but others are annoyed because Chrome doesn't have this menu.

I've just tested it on these browser versions, and found out the page renders/loads fine in IE9, I hadn't tried IE at all until now:
Firefox 24.0
Chrome 30.0
Internet Explorer 9.0
fields.summary: Crucible no longer works in a HTML frameset

Hi there,

In Crucible 2.7.13 no mail notification is triggered when adding a patch in the repository.

fields.description: When i upload a svn patch file via "Pre-commit" feature, i'm unable to display more than 3 lines of context. "No Context" works and "3 Lines" context works. But if i try "20 Lines", "100 Lines" or "Full Context", still only 3 lines of context are shown.
fields.summary: Disable context options if they are not available for a pre-commit review

fields.description:
This bug was found while using FishEye/Crucible 2.7.11
I also added a comment in closed bug CRUC-612 because it was the only one that showed up for me when I did a search on the error string.

I started a new review and uploaded a pre-commit patch with 5 files.  I made comments on 4/5 files.  None of the invited reviewers had yet looked at the review.  I later uploaded an updated pre-commit patch and wanted to remove the original patch as none of the reviewers had yet looked at the review.  I could only remove the one file with no existing comments.  I then deleted all comments.  I, as the review creator, was the only one who had yet made comments or read them.  When I again tried to remove the files, I could remove some of the files that previously had comments, but not others.  The error I received was "Could not remove ... as it has comments." where ... contained the path to the file.  This error continues to persist even after coming back the next day.
fields.summary: Error removing files from pre-commit patch

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Create a JIRA Project 'JIRAPROJECT'
# Add two repos to FishEye: 'REPO1' and 'REPO2'
# Create two Crucible Projects in Crucible: 'REPO1PROJECT' and 'REPO2PROJECT'
# Set project 'REPO1PROJECT' to have repo 'REPO1' as the default repository
# Set project 'REPO2PROJECT' to have repo 'REPO2' as the default repository
# Add an Application Link from JIRA to FishEye/Crucible
# Make sure that no reciprocal link created from FishEye/Crucible to JIRA 
# Set it to have Basic Authentication from JIRA to FishEye/Crucible
# Push a commit with message "JIRAPROJECT-1" to 'REPO1'
# Create review from JIRA issue 'JIRAPROJECT-1'
# Push a commit with message "JIRAPROJECT-2" to 'REPO2'
# Create review from JIRA issue 'JIRAPROJECT-2'

The create review dialog does not choose the project that have the repo as the default repository.
fields.summary: Creating Review from JIRA Issue Source Tab should choose the project that have the repo as the default repository

fields.description:
Hi,

It's the second time I see this bug:

I create a git patch using eclipse and I upload it into crucibe for a code review. At the last line of the patch, a difference (carriage return removed) is shown when there is nothing in my file.

I suspect a CR/LF problem with the patch or the patched file.

Here are 2 examples:
  http://reviews.openpilot.org/cru/OPReview-574#CFR-15030
  http://reviews.openpilot.org/cru/OPReview-579
fields.summary: Wrong diff displayed on the last line of a patch file!

fields.description:
There isn't a link to the [Using Crucible|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Crucible] documentation on the [Crucible Documentation Home|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Crucible+Documentation+Home]. When clicking the Crucible Help menu item, while using Crucible, the help page directs the user to the aforementioned Crucible Documentation Home. This is not helpful to most users because the documentation home mostly contains documentation on administering Crucible. It crucially lacks a link to Using Crucible.

In addition, searching for "[Crucible User's Guide|https://support.atlassian.com/customer/search?q=crucible+users+manual]" only returns documentation for outdated versions of Crucible. Searching for "[Crucible User's Manual|https://support.atlassian.com/customer/search?q=crucible+users+manual]" returns the same.

It would be nice is the Crucible documentation home had a prominent link to Using Crucible or if Crucible's help menu item directed the user to Using Crucible.
fields.summary: Improve Discoverability of "Using Crucible" Documentation

fields.description: The review size limits are applied to the review before the patch is added to it which makes the limit enforcement ineffective for new reviews
fields.summary: Patch Limits are only applied to the existing review

fields.description:
This [document|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Choosing+reviewers] needs to be updated, because this is misleading users to add reviewers in Crucible.

Here we can find this:
{quote}
Select users by typing names into the text field under Reviewers. Crucible will show a list of matches. Press Enter to select one after each entry.

Clicking Done will save the review as a draft for later issue.

You can also decide to allow any registered user to add themselves as a reviewer in the review. To enable this option, select Allow anyone to join.
{quote}

Which in fact works only according with this:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Creating+a+project

{quote}
Use Users and Groups to restrict who can have a role (author/creator/moderator/reviewer) in this project's reviews. These users will be the only ones whose names appear when a review is assigned. Leave these fields blank to allow all users to have access.
{quote}


Can this document be fixed?

Regards,
Celso Yoshioka
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: Improvement of Crucible documentation.

fields.description:
If you have a project configured with only one group defined under "Allowed Review Participants" and add a reviewer to a review from outside the group (the option "Allow anyone to join" is checked) the user is added on the edit review screen but the information isn't saved.

There should be a message indicating that the project is restricted to users from the group configured on the project admin page.

h4. Workaround

- Removed the "Allowed Review Participants" restriction on the Project.
- Create a Permissions Scheme specifically for the Crucible project.
-- Limit the last permission "View" to only the group allowed + Reviewers role

This will allow only the indicated group to view the project and reviews in addition to anyone else added to the review. Any subsequent review that is created won't be visible to the outside reviewer if they aren't added to the review as a reviewer.
fields.summary: Provide visual feedback that a Crucible project is restricted to "Allowed Review Participants"

fields.description:
As per the [list here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/System+Properties], the property {{crucible.review.file.revisions.limit}} can be used in 2.10.0 to configure this limit, though unfortunately it appears to be [ineffective|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-6562] at the moment.
It would be good to have this property extended to all versions of Fisheye/Crucible from 2.10.x onwards.
fields.summary: Make 800 file revisions per review limit configurable for all versions of Fisheye/Crucible

fields.description:
After upgrading Crucible/Fisheye from 2.6.1 to 3.1.4 the notifications when creating a review stopped working.

- We still receive Fisheye notifications for each commit
- Test email from Administration works
- When clicking on "Share" button on a review we don't get notifications but see this in the logs:
2013-10-16 14:26:20,861 ERROR - Error processing notification

Macro layout has no such argument: share
The problematic instruction:
----------
==> macro layout [on line 11, column 1 in crucible/html/crucible-layout.ftl]
 in user-directive layout [on line 6, column 1 in crucible/html/share-notification.ftl]

I'm pretty sure we didn't modify those templates.

We found this thread but it didn't help: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/66427/crucible-not-sending-email-notifications-but-fisheye-sending-watch-emails

Thank you

fields.description:
The Moderator should be able to re-assign his role to someone else. 
This is useful in cases where he will be out of office for a trip, for example.
fields.summary: Allow moderator to re-assign his role to someone else

fields.description:
This would make it easier to refer to a specific comment when holding review meetings, etc.  As it is, some reviews have hundred of comments and replies, and finding the specific one(s) you want to discuss in a meeting can be problematic.  

Replies don't necessarily need a number, just the initial Comment/Defect.

I note you already have comment identifier numbers in the custom link you provide to each individual comment.  If you could just make that existing number visible (perhaps inside the existing link graphic?) that would work for my purposes.  I don't need the identifying number to start at 1 for each individual review.  I just need a way to allow easy reference to a specific comment in verbal situations.  I can easily say Comment #cXXXX if I can see it.  Currently, the number is hidden in the linking URL, and in a meeting we can't reveal each link location to find a specific one.
fields.summary: Would like top-level comments/defects to have identifying number

fields.description:
In Crucible 3.1 we have introduced the following changes to the way reviews can be shared:

- We removed the _Email review_ link from the tools as it as providing the same content as _Download review as text_. 

- We removed the _Send reminder_ link from the tools menu to promote using the sharing button instead.

- If review is overdue the _Share_ link says _Send reminder_ instead and clicking on it opens the share dialog with the list of uncompleted reviewers pre-selected. 

Those changes should be reflected in the documentation for the latest Crucible:
- [Sending a review's comments via email|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Sending+a+review%27s+comments+via+Email] should be amended: the user will have to download the comments as text via _Download review as text_ and then use the generated txt file to send it via their own email client.
- [Using review reminders|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Review+Reminders] should be changed in the _Manual Reminders_ section and describe the new behaviour of the _Share_ button.

Thanks,

Sten
fields.summary: Document changes to the sharing features of Crucible

fields.description:
Hello,

In Crucible 3.1.4, when logged in to Crucible the following features are no longer visible but remains documented in the latest Crucible user documenation:
* Email Review documented in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Sending+a+review%27s+comments+via+Email
* Notify Pending Reviewers documented https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Using+Review+Reminders: The "Notify Pending Reviewers" is not listed under Tools for the reviews that I am moderator for.

Are the above features still available? If yes, what configuration needs to occur for these features to appear in the Tools menu.

Thank-you!

Regards,

Sylvia

fields.description:
Microsoft SQL Server supports Integrated Authentication for database connections, where a username and password are not supplied in the connection string, but rather the db connection is authenticated based on the user the crucible process is running as. Both the jTDS and Microsoft JDBC drivers support Integrated Authentication, and suppport have had success in configuring it for customers:

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/168576/using-ms-sql-integrated-authentication-with-bamboo-and-fisheye 

Test that Integrated Authentication works correctly, and make it part of the documented and supported platform.
fields.summary: Verify the use of Integrated Authentication with SQL Server

fields.description:
We have the following layout in our repository:
{noformat}
/project1
    /trunk
    /branches
    /tags
/project2
    /trunk
    /branches
    /tags
{noformat}
When i navigate to /project1 and try to open the Review Coverage Report there, the page will not finish to load. {{project1}} has many changesets and branches are created quite frequently. If i navigate to the {{trunk}} folder, page loads, if i navigate to the branches subfolder, page won't load.
Same is true for the Changeset Review Coverage gadget.
I really think that the Crucible reports and gadgets are good tools, but don't seem to get the attention by Atlassian they deserve. They all look a little outdated, so it seems there is no time invested here.

If I manually update the message in comment with id 7591:

mysql> update cru_comment set cru_message='Тест' where cru_comment_id=7591;

It shows correct value in cyrillic encoding.

Solution from https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=376832337 doesn't work:

$ ps aux | grep cruc
crucible  7839 16.3  1.8 13100536 1234420 pts/1 Sl  14:01   3:32 /opt/crucible/jdk1.6.0_19/bin/java -Xmx8G -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -XX:MaxNewSize=128m -Dfisheye.library.path= -Dfisheye.inst=/opt/crucible/3.0 -Djava.awt.headless=true -Djava.endorsed.dirs=/opt/crucible/3.0/lib/endorsed -jar /opt/crucible/3.0/fisheyeboot.jar start

fields.description:
Fecru emails send out emails in batches, but (unfortunately) fecru tells how many events are in the batch in the email subject. That causes email client to be confused whether these emails are a thread or not. In the effect, I got:
# 5 emails, that a review got 2 new comments,
# one email each for adding, 1, 3, 5 and 6 comments.

It's a busy review. People comment a lot. That's even more of a reason to allow my email client to collapse them all as one thread (which it is). 

If possible, please attempt at removing the number of added comments/changesets etc. from the subject, while keeping the awesome batching feature.
fields.summary: As a mail client user, I want Fecru emails from one review to stack

fields.description:
Hi guys !!!
I'm from Sberbank-CIB and now we are using your code review system - Crucible.
 
We had tested your system on small repositories and hadn't got any problems.
 
But when we create link for our main repository (more then 400 Mb) we have a problem. All our comments in russian displayed as unreadable characters. This problem solves when we make a commit on some of scripts, but it's imposible to recommit all scripts in our main repository.
 
I've changed repository option "charset" on windows-1251 and reindexed FishEye repository, but it don't solve my problem.
 
When I change this option in our small repository, it solved our problem with unreadable characters.
 
Please Help us, It's a stopper task in integrating your code review system in our process.
 
Kind regards,
Rinat Sharipov
Developer
IT Department
CJSC "Sberbank CIB"

fields.summary: Hibernate constraint violation when adding reviewers

fields.description:
/users-v1 returns a full set of users.

For performance reasons it would be great to get only a selected users if needed.
fields.summary: Make it possible to query only selected users via REST

fields.description:
Currently /users-v1/username returns only data for the current user. If you try to ask for a different user you'll get NotPermittedException. Although you can actually get the same data for all users using /users-v1

It's inconsistent and slow for a use case when you want to ask for only a few users.
fields.summary: REST /users-v1/username should return a limited data set for other users

fields.description:
Currently crucible/avatar/username will always return avatar from internal database. Even if Crucible is configured to use an external avatar provider.

/avatar/username is the only place to ask for avatar for any random user, it's worth fixing it to return the same avatar that REST is returning.
fields.summary: Should return avatar from external server if configured

fields.description:
I would like to have a condition that prevents a workflow if the Issue does not have any linked review.

I know there is the "Unreviewed Code Condition" but this goes too far for us as there are some commits you don't want to have in your review, or are merge commits or are commits commited to this Issue by accident (wrong ticket number in commit message).

All this led to much discomfort with using the above condition and therefore we disabled it.
However the main reason we added this condition in the first place was because we always want an Issue to have at least one review.

I tried to solve this by using the "Calculated Number Field" (from [JIRA Misc Custom Fields|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.innovalog.jmcf.jira-misc-custom-fields] plugin) but was not able to create a number field that returns the count of linked reviews (but I was btw. able to create a field that counts the number of sub tasks, so a Story can't be started without ones. Great plugin!)

Or is there any other way I can accomplish this?
fields.summary: Has Review Condition

fields.description:
There are certain conditions that can lead to a BatchUpdateException when reading file or updating files (that would trigger read status to change).

The exception can be displayed with various exceptions depending on the database driver being used. Examples:
* java.sql.BatchUpdateException: Duplicate entry '9-1' for key 2
* Duplicate entry '1476-4608' for key 'cru_participant'

This is caused due to incorrect assumptions in the code. It is reproducable by:
* create a review with 2 files
* start the review
* add a reviewer
* read the first file as the reviewer
* in 2 separate threads:
** add a new revision to the second file
** add a different new revision to the second file

This can cause a race condition. The symptom of the failure is that the second update will fail. The user will be given a message saying that the update failed and that the action will need to be performed again.
fields.summary: Race condition when creating the FileReadStatus

Scenario to reproduce:

 # pick up a branch/commiter so you can see several changesets with checkboxes.  Changesets should be touching same files.

fields.description:
In JIRA there is the concept of groups and roles. The groups get the permissions of the roles to which they are associated. It is possible to enter single users to a project role, so that, for example, external workers can get the permissions for the desired project by adding them to a project role. This is independent from the permission scheme. 

It would be nice if there is a possibility to do this in FishEye/Crucible as well. It takes a lot more time to create a new group and a new permission scheme for each project that has external workers than to let a project administrator add a single user in a project role in "People" in JIRA. This is preferable to having 40 permission schemes for 40 projects with external workers, because then changing the permissions will create overhead.

In FishEye it is better than in Crucible, since in FishEye there are no permission schemes but only direct permissions of the groups and only "yes/no" options (see the repository or not), but here also a new group for each external worker would have to be created.
fields.summary: Ability to Manage Permissions Based on Roles

fields.description:
During the 3.0.x upgrade Crucible attempts to remove duplicated stored paths from the database.  Apparently the deduplication task breaks if there are any unprocessed cru_feindex_msg rows.  Those tasks are usually consumed on every incremental scan of the repository, unless pulling was disabled.

Fix would require changes to the deduplication script to handle this case.

As a workaround user may want to run old instance one more time, ensure all repositories are scanned incrementally (either via automated pulling or via manual incremental run triggered from administration/repositories/repository page)
fields.summary: Upgrade to 3.0.x may fail if there are unprocessed cru_feindex_msg rows

fields.description:
searching {{/rest-service/search-v1/reviews?term=DEMO-}}

should return all Reviews containing "DEMO-" in:
* title
* objectives
* linked issue

Searching for "DEMO-1" does return Reviews based on the Linked Issue.

The lucene query is doing an exact match search on the Linked Issue field. This means that Reviews using only the LinkedIssue field will not be displayed in the JIRA Project Reviews tab. (but will be displayed in the Issues Source tab)

(gray) Default Project

           Under review
           [a line full of graphics]
another bar containing additional stuff that I don't care about right now

then within the subpane itself:
   (white) [name of file, abbreviated, even though there is plenty of horizontal room, so clearly you are aware this could be a problem]
  (darker gray) something about revisions and iterations, a lot of vertical space.

FINALLY the code to review.

But foolishly I made a wordy comment, and it fills half the remaining space, and I cannot figure out how to minimize the damn thing.  There may be a way, but exploring with my mouse does not make it wake up to offer me the option.

Because I am also, foolishly, running this within a VM (because the code review tool is on the company internet, and because VPN is configured with busted proxy options -- not your problem, but part of the world we live in -- I run the VPN in a VM -- plus it is safer for my employer anyhow) I am now able to see all of SIX lines of code, total, around the place where I made my comment.  I'm doing my best to minimize everything ELSE here so that I get more vertical space, but this is not exactly first-class on your part.

Note that I am aware that 3.0.2 exists, but I could not tell from the upgrade options if this was for the server (not my problem) or client (my problem).  It seemed unlikely that it was for me (isn't it all pushed from the server?) but who can tell for sure?

fields.description:
When creating a review using the crucible.py script from command line and linking to a GIT repo, the added patch includes fake differences about removed line feeds which were not part of the original diff.
If the script is called without linking to a git repo, then the patch is correctly uploaded.

h5.Example 1: not link to any repo
{noformat}
git format-patch -1 -N --stdout | crucible.py -m "title" PROJ @reviewer
{noformat}
Patch is correctly uploaded:
!cru1.png!

h5.Example 2: link to a GIT repo
{noformat}
git format-patch -1 -N --stdout | crucible.py -m "title" -r repo PROJ @reviewer
{noformat}
Patch is uploaded with a fake difference as if a line feed was removed:
!cru2.png!
fields.summary: crucible.py script adds fake differences regarding line feeds when linking to git repo

fields.description:
h3.Steps to reproduce
# Edit a review and search for files to be added to the review
# Search for the revision modified on a branch with EQL eg:
{noformat}
select revisions where modified on branch branch1
{noformat}
# Click on the link "Add all x revisions"
The latest revision is selected
# Modified the same file in the latest revision and commit it to SVN server
# Wait for FishEye/Crucible to perform incremental index (Do not restart the repository)
# Search for the latest revision with the same EQL in step 2
# Click on the link "Remove all revisions from review"
